intro: Pristimera andongensis var. volkensii, commonly known as the Andong mountain begonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking foliage and delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped with a waxy surface, and it produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species.
